statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Given a tree with $N$ vertices and $N - 1$ edges. Each vertex has a single letter $C_i$. Given a string $S$, you are to choose two vertices A and B, and make sure the letters catenated on the shortest path from A to B is exactly S. Now, would you mind telling me whether the path exists?

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
The first line is an integer T, the number of test cases.
For each case, the first line is an integer $N$. Following $N - 1$ lines contains two integers a and b, meaning there is an edge connect vertex a and vertex b.
Next line contains a string C, the length of C is exactly $N$. String C represents the letter on each vertex.
Next line contains a string S.
$1 \leq T \leq 200$, $1 \leq N \leq 10^4$, $1 \leq a, b \leq N$, $a \neq b$, $|C| = N$, $1 \leq |S| \leq 10^4$. String C and S both only contain lower case letters.

statement.title: Output
statement.content:
First, please output "Case #k: ", k is the number of test case. See sample output for more detail.
If the path exists, please output “Find”. Otherwise, please output “Impossible”.

statement.title: Sample Input
statement.content:
2

7
1 2
2 3
2 4
1 5
5 6
6 7
abcdefg
dbaefg

5
1 2
2 3
2 4
4 5
abcxy
yxbac
